   19: %%
   20: -module(erl_lint_SUITE).
   21: 
   22: %%-define(debug, true).
   23: 
   24: -ifdef(debug).
   25: -define(line, put(line, ?LINE), ).
   26: -define(config(X,Y), foo).
   27: -define(datadir, "erl_lint_SUITE_data").
   28: -define(privdir, "erl_lint_SUITE_priv").
   29: -define(t, test_server).
   30: -else.
   31: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   32: -define(datadir, proplists:get_value(data_dir, Conf)).
   33: -define(privdir, proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Conf)).
   34: -endif.
   35: 
   36: -export([all/0, suite/0, groups/0]).
   37: 
   38: -export([singleton_type_var_errors/1,
   39:          unused_vars_warn_basic/1,
   40:          unused_vars_warn_lc/1,
   41:          unused_vars_warn_rec/1,
   42:          unused_vars_warn_fun/1,
   43:          unused_vars_OTP_4858/1,
   44:          unused_unsafe_vars_warn/1,
   45:          export_vars_warn/1,
   46:          shadow_vars/1,
   47:          unused_import/1,
   48:          unused_function/1,
   49:          unsafe_vars/1,unsafe_vars2/1,
   50:          unsafe_vars_try/1,
   51:          unsized_binary_in_bin_gen_pattern/1,
   52:          guard/1, otp_4886/1, otp_4988/1, otp_5091/1, otp_5276/1, otp_5338/1,
   53:          otp_5362/1, otp_5371/1, otp_7227/1, binary_aliases/1,
   54:          otp_5494/1, otp_5644/1, otp_5878/1,
   55:          otp_5917/1, otp_6585/1, otp_6885/1, otp_10436/1, otp_11254/1,
   56:          otp_11772/1, otp_11771/1, otp_11872/1,
   57:          export_all/1,
   58:          bif_clash/1,
   59:          behaviour_basic/1, behaviour_multiple/1, otp_11861/1,
   60:          otp_7550/1,
   61:          otp_8051/1,
   62:          format_warn/1,
   63:          on_load_successful/1, on_load_failing/1,
   64:          too_many_arguments/1,
   65:          basic_errors/1,bin_syntax_errors/1,
   66:          predef/1,
   67:          maps/1,maps_type/1,maps_parallel_match/1,
   68:          otp_11851/1,otp_11879/1,otp_13230/1,
   69:          record_errors/1, otp_11879_cont/1,
   70:          non_latin1_module/1, illegal_module_name/1, otp_14323/1,
   71:          stacktrace_syntax/1,
   72:          otp_14285/1, otp_14378/1,
   73:          external_funs/1,otp_15456/1,otp_15563/1,
   74:          unused_type/1,binary_types/1,removed/1, otp_16516/1,
   75:          inline_nifs/1,
   76:          undefined_nifs/1,
   77:          no_load_nif/1,
   78:          warn_missing_spec/1,
   79:          otp_16824/1,
   80:          underscore_match/1,
   81:          unused_record/1,
   82:          unused_type2/1,
   83:          eep49/1,
   84:          redefined_builtin_type/1,
   85:          tilde_k/1,
   86:          match_float_zero/1,
   87:          undefined_module/1,
   88:          maybe_expression_guard/1]).
   89: 
   90: suite() ->
   91:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   92:      {timetrap,{minutes,1}}].
   93: 
   94: all() -> 
   95:     [{group, unused_vars_warn}, export_vars_warn,
   96:      shadow_vars, unused_import, unused_function,
   97:      unsafe_vars, unsafe_vars2, unsafe_vars_try, guard,
   98:      unsized_binary_in_bin_gen_pattern,
   99:      otp_4886, otp_4988, otp_5091, otp_5276, otp_5338,
  100:      otp_5362, otp_5371, otp_7227, binary_aliases, otp_5494, otp_5644,
  101:      otp_5878, otp_5917, otp_6585, otp_6885, otp_10436, otp_11254,
  102:      otp_11772, otp_11771, otp_11872, export_all,
  103:      bif_clash, behaviour_basic, behaviour_multiple, otp_11861,
  104:      otp_7550, otp_8051, format_warn, {group, on_load},
  105:      too_many_arguments, basic_errors, bin_syntax_errors, predef,
  106:      maps, maps_type, maps_parallel_match,
  107:      otp_11851, otp_11879, otp_13230,
  108:      record_errors, otp_11879_cont,
  109:      non_latin1_module, illegal_module_name, otp_14323,
  110:      stacktrace_syntax, otp_14285, otp_14378, external_funs,
  111:      otp_15456, otp_15563, unused_type, binary_types, removed, otp_16516,
  112:      undefined_nifs,
  113:      no_load_nif,
  114:      inline_nifs, warn_missing_spec, otp_16824,
  115:      underscore_match, unused_record, unused_type2,
  116:      eep49,
  117:      redefined_builtin_type,
  118:      tilde_k,
  119:      singleton_type_var_errors,
  120:      match_float_zero,
  121:      undefined_module,
  122:      maybe_expression_guard].
  123: 
  124: groups() -> 
  125:     [{unused_vars_warn, [],
  126:       [unused_vars_warn_basic, unused_vars_warn_lc,
  127:        unused_vars_warn_rec, unused_vars_warn_fun,
  128:        unused_vars_OTP_4858, unused_unsafe_vars_warn]},
  129:      {on_load, [], [on_load_successful, on_load_failing]}].
  130: 
  131: 
  132: %% Warnings for unused variables in some simple cases.
  133: unused_vars_warn_basic(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  134:     Ts = [{basic1,
  135:            <<"f(F) -> % F unused.
  136:                 ok.
  137: 
  138: f(F, F) ->
  139:     ok.
  140: 
  141: g(_X) ->
  142:     y.
  143: 
  144: h(P) ->
  145:     P.
  146: 
  147: x(N) ->
  148:     case a:b() of
  149: 	[N|Y] -> % Y unused.
  150: 	    ok
  151:     end.
  152: 
  153: y(N, L) ->
  154:     lists:map(fun(T) -> T*N end, L).
  155: 
  156: z(N, L) -> % N unused
  157:     lists:map(fun(N, T) -> T*N end, L).  % N shadowed.
  158: 
  159: 
  160: c(A) ->
  161:     case A of
  162: 	1 -> B = []; % B unused.
  163: 	2 -> B = []; % B unused.
  164: 	3 -> B = f, B
  165:     end.
  166: ">>,
  167: 	   [warn_unused_vars],
  168: {warnings,[{{1,23},erl_lint,{unused_var,'F'}},
  169: 	   {{15,5},erl_lint,{unused_var,'Y'}},
  170: 	   {{22,3},erl_lint,{unused_var,'N'}},
  171: 	   {{23,19},erl_lint,{shadowed_var,'N','fun'}},
  172: 	   {{28,7},erl_lint,{unused_var,'B'}},
  173: 	   {{29,7},erl_lint,{unused_var,'B'}}]}},
  174:           {basic2,
  175:            <<"-record(r, {x,y}).
  176:               f({X,Y}) -> {Z=X,Z=Y};
  177:               f([H|T]) -> [Z=H|Z=T];
  178:               f(#r{x=X,y=Y}) -> #r{x=A=X,y=A=Y}.
  179:               g({M, F}) -> (Z=M):(Z=F)();
  180:               g({M, F, Arg}) -> (Z=M):F(Z=Arg).
  181:               h(X, Y) -> (Z=X) + (Z=Y).">>,
  182:            [warn_unused_vars], []},
  183:           {basic3,
  184:            <<"f(E) ->
  185:                   X = Y = E.">>,
  186:            [warn_unused_vars],
  187:            {warnings,[{{2,19},erl_lint,{unused_var,'X'}},
  188:                       {{2,23},erl_lint,{unused_var,'Y'}}]}}],
  189:     [] = run(Config, Ts),
  190:     ok.
  191: 
  192: %% Warnings for unused variables in list comprehensions.
  193: unused_vars_warn_lc(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  194:     Ts = [{lc1, 
  195:            <<"bin([X]) ->
  196:                   [A || <<A:X>> <- []]; % X used, not shadowed.
  197:               bin({X}) ->
  198:                   [X || <<X:X>> <- []]; % X used, and shadowed.
  199:               bin({X,Y,Z}) ->
  200:                   [{A,B} || <<A:X>> <- Z, <<B:Y>> <- Z];
  201:               bin([X,Y,Z]) -> % Y unused.
  202:                   [C || <<V:X>> <- Z, <<B:V>> <- Z, <<C:B>> <- Z].
  203:            ">>, 
  204:            [warn_unused_vars],
  205:            {warnings, [{{4,27},erl_lint,{shadowed_var,'X',generate}},
  206:                        {{7,22},erl_lint,{unused_var,'Y'}}]}},
  207: 
  208:           {lc2,
  209:            <<"bin([X]) ->
  210:                   [A || <<A:X>> <- []]; % X used, not shadowed.
  211:               bin({X}) ->
  212:                   [X || <<X:X>> <- []]; % X used, and shadowed.
  213:               bin({X,Y,Z}) ->
  214:                   [{A,B} || <<A:X>> <- Z, <<B:Y>> <- Z];
  215:               bin([X,Y,Z]) -> % Y unused.
  216:                   [C || <<V:X>> <- Z, <<B:V>> <- Z, <<C:B>> <- Z].
  217:            ">>,
  218:            [warn_unused_vars],
  219:            {warnings,[{{4,27},erl_lint,{shadowed_var,'X',generate}},
  220:                       {{7,22},erl_lint,{unused_var,'Y'}}]}},
  221: 
  222:           {lc3,
  223:            <<"a([A]) ->
  224:                   B = foo,
  225:                   [{C,B} || {C,_} <- A];
  226:               a({A}) ->
  227:                   B = foo,
  228:                   [C || {C,_} <- [B,A]];
  229:               a({A,A}) ->
  230:                   B = foo,
  231:                   [C || {C,_} <- B, B < A].
  232:            ">>,
  233:            [warn_unused_vars],
  234:            []},
  235: 
  236:           {lc4,
  237:            <<"b(A) ->
  238:                   B = foo, % B unused.
  239:                   [C || {C,_} <- A].
  240:            ">>,
  241:            [warn_unused_vars],
  242:            {warnings,[{{2,19},erl_lint,{unused_var,'B'}}]}},
  243: 
  244:           {lc5,
  245:            <<"c(A) ->
  246:                   B = foo,
  247:                   [C || {C,_} <- A],
  248:                   B.
  249:            ">>,
  250:            [warn_unused_vars],
  251:            []},
  252: 
  253:           {lc6,
  254:            <<"d(A) ->
  255:                   B = foo,
  256:                   [{A,B} || {Id,_} <- A]. % Id unused.
  257:            ">>,
  258:            [warn_unused_vars],
  259:            {warnings,[{{3,30},erl_lint,{unused_var,'Id'}}]}},
  260: 
  261:           {lc7,
  262:            <<"e(A) ->
  263:                   B = foo, % B unused.
  264:                   [B || B <- A]. % B shadowed.
  265:            ">>,
  266:            [warn_unused_vars],
  267:            {warnings,[{{2,19},erl_lint,{unused_var,'B'}},
  268:                       {{3,25},erl_lint,{shadowed_var,'B',generate}}]}},
  269: 
  270:           {lc8,
  271:            <<"f(A) ->
  272:                   B = foo,
  273:                   [B || B <- A], % B shadowed.
  274:                   B.
  275:            ">>,
  276:            [warn_unused_vars],
  277:            {warnings,[{{3,25},erl_lint,{shadowed_var,'B',generate}}]}},
  278: 
  279:           {lc9,
  280:            <<"g(A) ->
  281:                   B = foo, % B unused.
  282:                   [A || B <- A]. % B shadowed, B unused.
  283:            ">>,
  284:            [warn_unused_vars],
  285:            {warnings,[{{2,19},erl_lint,{unused_var,'B'}},
  286:                       {{3,25},erl_lint,{unused_var,'B'}},
  287:                       {{3,25},erl_lint,{shadowed_var,'B',generate}}]}},
  288: 
  289:           {lc10,
  290:            <<"h(A) ->
  291:                   B = foo,
  292:                   [A || B <- A], % B shadowed, B unused.
  293:                   B.
  294:            ">>,
  295:            [warn_unused_vars],
  296:            {warnings,[{{3,25},erl_lint,{unused_var,'B'}},
  297:                       {{3,25},erl_lint,{shadowed_var,'B',generate}}]}},
  298: 
  299:           {lc11,
  300:            <<"i(X) ->
  301:                   [Z || Z <- X, % Z unused.
  302:                         Z = X <- [foo]]. % X and Z shadowed. X unused!
  303:            ">>,
  304:            [warn_unused_vars],
  305:            {warnings,[{{2,25},erl_lint,{unused_var,'Z'}},
  306:                       {{3,25},erl_lint,{shadowed_var,'Z',generate}},
  307:                       {{3,29},erl_lint,{unused_var,'X'}},
  308:                       {{3,29},erl_lint,{shadowed_var,'X',generate}}]}},
  309: 
  310:           {lc12,
  311:            <<"j({X}) ->
  312:                   [Z || Z <- X, % Z unused.
  313:                         Z <- X = [[1,2,3]], % Z shadowed. Z unused.
  314:                         Z <- X, % Z shadowed. Z unused.
  315:                         Z <- X]; % Z shadowed.
  316:               j(X) ->
  317:                   [foo || X <- X, % X shadowed.
  318:                         X <-    % X shadowed. X unused.
  319:                              X =
  320:                                  Y = [[1,2,3]], % Y unused.
  321:                         X <- [], % X shadowed.
  322:                         X <- X]. % X shadowed. X unused.
  323:            ">>,
  324:            [warn_unused_vars],
  325:            {warnings,[{{2,25},erl_lint,{unused_var,'Z'}},
  326:                       {{3,25},erl_lint,{unused_var,'Z'}},
  327:                       {{3,25},erl_lint,{shadowed_var,'Z',generate}},
  328:                       {{4,25},erl_lint,{unused_var,'Z'}},
  329:                       {{4,25},erl_lint,{shadowed_var,'Z',generate}},
  330:                       {{5,25},erl_lint,{shadowed_var,'Z',generate}},
  331:                       {{7,27},erl_lint,{shadowed_var,'X',generate}},
  332:                       {{8,25},erl_lint,{unused_var,'X'}},
  333:                       {{8,25},erl_lint,{shadowed_var,'X',generate}},
  334:                       {{10,34},erl_lint,{unused_var,'Y'}},
  335:                       {{11,25},erl_lint,{shadowed_var,'X',generate}},
  336:                       {{12,25},erl_lint,{unused_var,'X'}},
  337:                       {{12,25},erl_lint,{shadowed_var,'X',generate}}]}},
  338: 
  339:           {lc13,
  340:            <<"k(X) ->
  341:                   [Z || Z <- Y = X]; % Y unused.
  342:               k(X) ->
  343:                   [Z || Z <- X = Y = X]; % Y unused!
  344:               k(X) ->
  345:                   [Z || Z <- begin X = Y = X, Y end];
  346:               k(X) ->
  347:                   [{Y,W} || W <- Y = X]; % Y unbound
  348:               k(X) ->
  349:                   [Z || Z <- (Y = X), % Y unused.
  350:                        Y > X]; % Y unbound.
  351:               k(X) ->
  352:                   [Y || Y = X > 3, Z = X]; % Z unused.
  353:               k(X) ->
  354:                   [Z || Y = X > 3, Z = X]. % Y unused.
  355:            ">>,
  356:            [warn_unused_vars],
  357:            {error,[{{8,21},erl_lint,{unbound_var,'Y'}},
  358:                    {{11,24},erl_lint,{unbound_var,'Y'}}],
  359:                   [{{2,30},erl_lint,{unused_var,'Y'}},
  360:                    {{4,34},erl_lint,{unused_var,'Y'}},
  361:                    {{8,34},erl_lint,{unused_var,'Y'}},
  362:                    {{10,31},erl_lint,{unused_var,'Y'}},
  363:                    {{13,36},erl_lint,{unused_var,'Z'}},
  364:                    {{15,25},erl_lint,{unused_var,'Y'}}]}},
  365: 
  366:           {lc14,
  367:            <<"lc2() ->
  368:                   Z = [[1],[2],[3]], 
  369:                   [X || Z <- Z, % Z shadowed.
  370:                         X <- Z].
  371:            ">>,
  372:            [warn_unused_vars],
  373:            {warnings,[{{3,25},erl_lint,{shadowed_var,'Z',generate}}]}},
  374: 
  375:           {lc15,
  376:            <<"lc3() ->
  377:                   Z = [1,2,3], 
  378:                   [X || X <- Z, 
  379:                         Z <- Z]. % Z shadowed. Z unused.
  380:            ">>,
  381:            [warn_unused_vars],
  382:            {warnings,[{{4,25},erl_lint,{unused_var,'Z'}},
  383:                       {{4,25},erl_lint,{shadowed_var,'Z',generate}}]}},
  384: 
  385:           {lc16,
  386:            <<"bin(Z) ->
  387:                   case bar of
  388:                       true ->
  389:                           U = 2;
  390:                       false ->
  391:                           true
  392:                   end,
  393:                   case bar of
  394:                       true ->
  395:                           X = 2;
  396:                       false ->
  397:                           X = 3
  398:                   end,
  399:                   case foo of
  400:                       true ->
  401:                           Y = 3; % Y unused.
  402:                       false ->
  403:                           4
  404:                   end,
  405:                   case foo of
  406:                       1 ->
  407:                           U; % U unsafe.
  408:                       2 ->
  409:                           [Z || <<U:X>> <- Z]; % (X exported.) U unused.
  410:                       3 ->
  411:                           [Z || <<U:X>> <- Z], % (X exported.) U unused.
  412:                           U % U unsafe.
  413:                   end.
  414:            ">>,
  415:            [warn_unused_vars],
  416:            {error,[{{22,27},erl_lint,{unsafe_var,'U',{'case',{2,19}}}},
  417:                    {{27,27},erl_lint,{unsafe_var,'U',{'case',{2,19}}}}],
  418:             [{{16,27},erl_lint,{unused_var,'Y'}},
  419:              {{24,35},erl_lint,{unused_var,'U'}},
  420:              {{26,35},erl_lint,{unused_var,'U'}}]}},
  421: 
  422:           {lc17,
  423:            <<"bin(Z) ->
  424:                   %% This used to pass erl_lint...
  425:                   case bar of
  426:                       true ->
  427:                           U = 2;
  428:                       false ->
  429:                           true
  430:                   end,
  431:                   case bar of
  432:                       true ->
  433:                           X = 2;
  434:                       false ->
  435:                           X = 3
  436:                   end,
  437:                   case foo of
  438:                       true ->
  439:                           Y = 3; % Y unused.
  440:                       false ->
  441:                           4
  442:                   end,
  443:                   [Z || <<U:X>> <- Z], % (X exported.) U unused.
  444:                   U. % U unsafe.
  445:            ">>,
  446:            [warn_unused_vars],
  447:            {error,[{{22,19},erl_lint,{unsafe_var,'U',{'case',{3,19}}}}],
  448:             [{{17,27},erl_lint,{unused_var,'Y'}},
  449:              {{21,27},erl_lint,{unused_var,'U'}}]}},
  450: 
  451:           {lc18,
  452:            <<"bin(Z) ->
  453:                   case bar of
  454:                       true ->
  455:                           U = 2;
  456:                       false ->
  457:                           true
  458:                   end,
  459:                   case bar of
  460:                       true ->
  461:                           X = 2;
  462:                       false ->
  463:                           X = 3
  464:                   end,
  465:                   case foo of
  466:                       true ->
  467:                           Y = 3;
  468:                       false ->
  469:                           4
  470:                   end,
  471:                   [B || <<U: % U unused
  472:                           U>> <- X, <<B:Y>> <- Z]. % U unsafe. Y unsafe. 
  473: 						% U shadowed. (X exported.)
  474:            ">>,
  475:            [warn_unused_vars],
  476:            {error,[{{21,27},erl_lint,{unsafe_var,'U',{'case',{2,19}}}},
  477:                    {{21,41},erl_lint,{unsafe_var,'Y',{'case',{14,19}}}}],
  478:             [{{20,27},erl_lint,{unused_var,'U'}}
  479:             ]}},
  480: 
  481:           {lc19,
  482:            <<"p({B,C}) ->
  483:                   <<A:B,A:C>> = <<17:32>>;
  484:               p(B) ->
  485:                   <<A:B>> = <<17:32>>. % A unused.
  486:            ">>,
  487:            [warn_unused_vars],
  488:            {warnings,[{{4,21},erl_lint,{unused_var,'A'}}]}},
  489: 
  490:           {lc20,
  491:            <<"c({I1,I2}) ->
  492:                   if
  493:                       <<I1:I2>> == <<>> ->
  494:                           foo
  495:                   end;
  496:               c([C1,C2]) -> % C1 unused.
  497:                   case foo of
  498:                       <<C2:C2,
  499:                         C3:C2>> -> % C3 unused.
  500:                           bar
  501:                   end.
  502: 
  503:            ">>,
  504:            [warn_unused_vars],
  505:            {warnings,[{{6,18},erl_lint,{unused_var,'C1'}},
  506:                       {{7,19},sys_core_fold,{nomatch,no_clause}},
  507:                       {{9,25},erl_lint,{unused_var,'C3'}}]}},
  508: 
  509:           {lc21,
  510:            <<"t() ->
  511:                   S = 8,
  512:                   case <<3:8>> of
  513:                       <<X:S>> ->
  514:                           X;
  515:                       <<S:X>> -> % X unbound
  516:                           foo
  517:                   end;
  518:               t() ->
  519:                   S = 8,
  520:                   case <<3:8>> of
  521:                       <<S:S>> ->
  522:                           S;
  523:                       <<Q:32>> -> % Q unused.
  524:                           foo
  525:                   end.
  526:            ">>,
  527:            [warn_unused_vars],
  528:            {error,[{{6,27},erl_lint,{unbound_var,'X'}}],
  529:                   [{{14,25},erl_lint,{unused_var,'Q'}}]}}
  530: 
  531:           ],
  532:     [] = run(Config, Ts),
  533:     ok.
  534: 
  535: 
  536: %% Warnings for unused variables in records.
  537: unused_vars_warn_rec(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  538:     Ts = [{rec1, % An example provided by Bjorn.
  539:            <<"-record(edge,
  540:                       {ltpr,
  541:                        ltsu,
  542:                        rtpr,
  543:                        rtsu
  544:                       }).
  545: 
  546:               f1(#edge{ltpr = A, ltsu = A}) ->
  547:                   true;
  548:               f1({Q, Q}) ->
  549:                   true.
  550: 
  551:               f2(Edge, Etab) ->
  552:                   case gb_trees:lookup(Edge, Etab) of
  553:                       {value,#edge{ltpr=Same,ltsu=Same}} -> ok;
  554:                       {value,_} -> error
  555:                   end.
  556: 
  557:               bar(Edge, Etab) ->
  558:                   case gb_trees:lookup(Edge, Etab) of
  559:                       {Same,Same} -> ok;
  560:                       {value,#edge{ltpr=Same}} -> ok; % Same unused.
  561:                       {value,_} -> error
  562:                   end.
  563:            ">>,
  564:            [warn_unused_vars],
  565:            {warnings,[{{22,41},erl_lint,{unused_var,'Same'}}]}},
  566:           {rec2,
  567:            <<"-record(r, {a,b}).
  568:               f(X, Y) -> #r{a=[K || K <- Y], b=[K || K <- Y]}.
  569:               g(X, Y) -> #r{a=lists:map(fun (K) -> K end, Y),
  570:                             b=lists:map(fun (K) -> K end, Y)}.
  571:               h(X, Y) -> #r{a=case Y of _ when is_list(Y) -> Y end,
  572:                             b=case Y of _ when is_list(Y) -> Y end}.
  573:               i(X, Y) -> #r{a=if is_list(Y) -> Y end, b=if is_list(Y) -> Y end}.
  574:              ">>,
  575:            [warn_unused_vars],
  576:            {warnings,[{{2,17},erl_lint,{unused_var,'X'}},
  577:                       {{3,17},erl_lint,{unused_var,'X'}},
  578:                       {{5,17},erl_lint,{unused_var,'X'}},
  579:                       {{7,17},erl_lint,{unused_var,'X'}}]}},
  580:           {rec3,
  581:            <<"-record(r, {a}).
  582:               t() -> X = 1, #r{a=foo, a=bar, a=qux}.
  583:              ">>,
  584:            [warn_unused_vars],
  585:            {error,[{{2,39},erl_lint,{redefine_field,r,a}},
  586:                    {{2,46},erl_lint,{redefine_field,r,a}}],
  587:                   [{{2,22},erl_lint,{unused_var,'X'}}]}}],
  588:     [] = run(Config, Ts),

  591: %% Warnings for unused variables in funs.

  780: %% Warnings for exported variables.
  781: export_vars_warn(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  782:     Ts = [{exp1,
  783:            <<"u() ->
  784:                   case foo of

  791:                           B = 2,
  792:                           Z = 4 % Z unused.
  793:                   end,

  797:                           X = 3, % X unused.

  801:                           B = 19, % B exported.
  802:                           U = 3; % U unused.

  804:                           X = 3,
  805:                           X;
  806:                       bar ->
  807:                           X = 9, % X unused.

  809:                   end.

  873: %% Shadowed variables are tested in other places, but here we test
  874: %% that the warning can be turned off.
  875: shadow_vars(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  876:     Ts = [{shadow1,
  877: 	   <<"bin(A) ->
  878:                   receive
  879:                       M ->
  880:                            X = M,
  881:                            Y = M,
  882:                            Z = M
  883:                   end,
  884:                   [B || <<B:X>> <- A],
  885:                   Y = B,
  886:                   [B || B <- Z]. % B shadowed.
  887:            ">>,
  888: 	   [nowarn_shadow_vars],
  889: 	   {error,[{{9,23},erl_lint,{unbound_var,'B'}}],
  890: 	    [{{9,19},erl_lint,{exported_var,'Y',{'receive',{2,19}}}}]}},
  891:           {shadow2,
  892:            <<"t() ->
  893:                   _ = (catch MS = MS = 1), % MS used unsafe
  894:                   _ = case ok of _ -> fun() -> ok end end,
  895:                   fun (MS) -> MS end. % MS not shadowed here
  896:            ">>,
  897:            [],
  898:            []}],
  899:     [] = run(Config, Ts),
  900:     ok.
  901:

 1036:     Ts = [{func1,

 1047: 	   {[]},				%Tuple indicates no 'export_all'.
 1048: 	   {warnings,[{{5,15},erl_lint,{unused_function,{fact,1}}},
 1049: 		      {{8,15},erl_lint,{unused_function,{fact_1,2}}}]}},
 1050: 
 1051: 	  %% Turn off warnings for unused functions.

 1055:                  lists:map(fun(X) -> 2*X end, L).

 1068:               t(L) ->

 1082:     Ts = [{func1,
 1083:            <<"-type foo() :: term().">>,
 1084:            {[]},                                %Tuple indicates no export_all

 1096:               -type foo() :: term().">>,

 2383: %% OTP-15456. All compiler options can now be given in the option list
 2384: %% (as opposed to only in files).
 2385: otp_15456(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2386:     Ts = [
 2387:           %% {nowarn_deprecated_function,[{M,F,A}]} can now be given
 2388:           %% in the option list as well as in an attribute.
 2389:           %% Wherever it occurs, it is not affected by
 2390:           %% warn_deprecated_function.
 2391:           {otp_15456_1,
 2392:            <<"-compile({nowarn_deprecated_function,{erlang,now,0}}).
 2393:               -export([foo/0]).
 2394: 
 2395:               foo() ->
 2396:                   {erlang:now(), random:seed0(), random:seed(1, 2, 3),
 2397:                    random:uniform(), random:uniform(42)}.
 2398:            ">>,
 2399:            {[{nowarn_deprecated_function,{random,seed0,0}},
 2400:              {nowarn_deprecated_function,[{random,uniform,0},
 2401:                                           {random,uniform,1}]},
 2402:              %% There should be no warnings when attempting to
 2403:              %% turn of warnings for functions that are not
 2404:              %% deprecated or not used in the module.
 2405:              {nowarn_deprecated_function,{random,uniform_s,1}},
 2406:              {nowarn_deprecated_function,{erlang,abs,1}},
 2407:              warn_deprecated_function]},
 2408:            {warnings,[{{5,50},erl_lint,
 2409:                        {deprecated,{random,seed,3},
 2410:                         "use the 'rand' module instead"}}]}},
 2411: 
 2412:           %% {nowarn_unused_function,[{M,F,A}]} can be given
 2413:           %% in the option list as well as in an attribute.
 2414:           %% It was incorrectly documented to only work when
 2415:           %% given in an attribute.
 2416:           {otp_15456_2,
 2417:            <<"-compile({nowarn_unused_function,foo/0}).
 2418:               foo() -> ok.
 2419:               bar() -> ok.
 2420:               foobar() -> ok.
 2421:               barf(_) -> ok.
 2422:               other() -> ok.
 2423:            ">>,
 2424:            {[{nowarn_unused_function,[{bar,0},{foobar,0}]},
 2425:              {nowarn_unused_function,{barf,1}},
 2426:              %% There should be no warnings when attempting to
 2427:              %% turn of warnings for unused functions that are not
 2428:              %% defined in the module.
 2429:              {nowarn_unused_function,{not_defined_in_module,1}},
 2430:              warn_unused_function]},
 2431:            {warnings,[{{6,15},erl_lint,{unused_function,{other,0}}}]}
 2432:           }],
 2433: 
 2434:     [] = run(Config, Ts),
 2435:     ok.

 3065:     Ts = [{clash1,
 3066:            <<"t(X) ->
 3067:                   size(X).
 3068: 
 3069:               %% No warning for the following calls, since they
 3070:               %% are unambigous.

 3083: 	  %% Verify that warnings cannot be turned off in the old way.

 3085:            <<"-export([t/1,size/1]).
 3086:               t(X) ->
 3087:                   size(X).
 3088: 
 3089:               size({N,_}) ->
 3090:                 N.
 3091: 
 3092:               %% My own abs/1 function works on lists too. From R14 this really works.
 3093:               abs([H|T]) when $a =< H, H =< $z -> [H-($a-$A)|abs(T)];
 3094:               abs([H|T]) -> [H|abs(T)];
 3095:               abs([]) -> [];
 3096:               abs(X) -> erlang:abs(X).
 3097:              ">>,
 3098: 	   {[nowarn_unused_function,nowarn_bif_clash]},
 3099: 	   {errors,[{erl_lint,disallowed_nowarn_bif_clash}],[]}},

 3101: 	  {clash3,
 3102:            <<"-export([size/1]).
 3103:               size({N,_}) ->
 3104:                 N;
 3105:               size(X) ->
 3106:                 erlang:size(X).
 3107:              ">>,
 3108: 	   [],
 3109: 	   []},
 3110: 	  %% But this is totally wrong - meaning of the program changed in R14, so this is an error
 3111: 	  {clash4,
 3112:            <<"-export([size/1]).
 3113:               size({N,_}) ->
 3114:                 N;
 3115:               size(X) ->
 3116:                 size(X).
 3117:              ">>,
 3118: 	   [],
 3119: 	   {errors,[{{5,17},erl_lint,{call_to_redefined_old_bif,{size,1}}}],[]}},
 3120: 	  %% For a post R14 bif, its only a warning
 3121: 	  {clash5,
 3122:            <<"-export([binary_part/2]).

 3124:                 binary_part(B,{X,Y});

 3126:                 binary:part(B,X,Y).
 3127:              ">>,
 3128: 	   [],
 3129: 	   {warnings,[{{3,17},erl_lint,{call_to_redefined_bif,{binary_part,2}}}]}},
 3130: 	  %% If you really mean to call yourself here, you can "unimport" size/1
 3131: 	  {clash6,
 3132:            <<"-export([size/1]).
 3133:               -compile({no_auto_import,[size/1]}).
 3134:               size([]) ->
 3135:                 0;

 3137:                 N;

 3139:                 1+size(T).

 3154:           %% but this doesn't mean the local function is allowed in a guard...

 3180:               -import(erlang,[binary_part/2]).
 3181:               x(X) ->
 3182:                  binary_part(X,{1,2}) =:= <<1,2>>.
 3183:              ">>,
 3184: 	   [],
 3185: 	   []},
 3186:           %% and actually use it in a guard...
 3187: 	  {clash11,
 3188:            <<"-export([x/1]).
 3189:               -compile({no_auto_import,[binary_part/2]}).
 3190:               -import(erlang,[binary_part/2]).
 3191:               x(X) when binary_part(X,{0,1}) =:= <<0>> ->
 3192:                  binary_part(X,{1,2}) =:= <<1,2>>.
 3193:              ">>,
 3194: 	   [],
 3195: 	   []},
 3196:           %% but for non-obvious historical reasons, imported functions cannot be used in
 3197: 	  %% fun construction without the module name...
 3198: 	  {clash12,
 3199:            <<"-export([x/1]).
 3200:               -compile({no_auto_import,[binary_part/2]}).
 3201:               -import(erlang,[binary_part/2]).
 3202:               x(X) when binary_part(X,{0,1}) =:= <<0>> ->
 3203:                  binary_part(X,{1,2}) =:= fun binary_part/2.
 3204:              ">>,
 3205: 	   [],
 3206: 	   {errors,[{{5,43},erl_lint,{undefined_function,{binary_part,2}}}],[]}},
 3207:           %% Not from erlang and not from anywhere else
 3208: 	  {clash13,
 3209:            <<"-export([x/1]).
 3210:               -compile({no_auto_import,[binary_part/2]}).
 3211:               -import(x,[binary_part/2]).
 3212:               x(X) ->
 3213:                  binary_part(X,{1,2}) =:= fun binary_part/2.
 3214:              ">>,
 3215: 	   [],
 3216: 	   {errors,[{{5,43},erl_lint,{undefined_function,{binary_part,2}}}],[]}},
 3217: 	  %% ...while real auto-import is OK.
 3218: 	  {clash14,
 3219:            <<"-export([x/1]).
 3220:               x(X) when binary_part(X,{0,1}) =:= <<0>> ->
 3221:                  binary_part(X,{1,2}) =:= fun binary_part/2.
 3222:              ">>,
 3223: 	   [],
 3224: 	   []},
 3225:           %% Import directive clashing with old bif is an error, regardless of if it's called or not
 3226: 	  {clash15,
 3227:            <<"-export([x/1]).
 3228:               -import(x,[abs/1]).
 3229:               x(X) ->
 3230:                  binary_part(X,{1,2}).
 3231:              ">>,
 3232: 	   [],
 3233: 	   {errors,[{{2,16},erl_lint,{redefine_old_bif_import,{abs,1}}}],[]}},
 3234: 	  %% For a new BIF, it's only a warning
 3235: 	  {clash16,
 3236:            <<"-export([x/1]).
 3237:               -import(x,[binary_part/3]).
 3238:               x(X) ->
 3239:                  abs(X).
 3240:              ">>,
 3241: 	   [],
 3242: 	   {warnings,[{{2,16},erl_lint,{redefine_bif_import,{binary_part,3}}}]}},
 3243: 	  %% And, you cannot redefine already imported things that aren't auto-imported
 3244: 	  {clash17,
 3245:            <<"-export([x/1]).
 3246:               -import(x,[binary_port/3]).
 3247:               -import(y,[binary_port/3]).
 3248:               x(X) ->
 3249:                  abs(X).
 3250:              ">>,
 3251: 	   [],
 3252: 	   {errors,[{{3,16},erl_lint,{redefine_import,{{binary_port,3},x}}}],[]}},
 3253: 	  %% Not with local functions either
 3254: 	  {clash18,
 3255:            <<"-export([x/1]).
 3256:               -import(x,[binary_port/3]).
 3257:               binary_port(A,B,C) ->
 3258:                  binary_part(A,B,C).
 3259:               x(X) ->
 3260:                  abs(X).
 3261:              ">>,
 3262: 	   [],
 3263: 	   {errors,[{{3,15},erl_lint,{define_import,{binary_port,3}}}],[]}},
 3264: 	  %% Like clash8: Dont accept a guard if it's explicitly module-name called either
 3265: 	  {clash19,
 3266:            <<"-export([binary_port/3]).
 3267:               -compile({no_auto_import,[binary_part/3]}).
 3268:               -import(x,[binary_part/3]).
 3269:               binary_port(A,B,C) when x:binary_part(A,B,C) ->
 3270:                  binary_part(A,B,C+1).
 3271:              ">>,
 3272: 	   [],
 3273: 	   {errors,[{{4,39},erl_lint,illegal_guard_expr}],[]}},
 3274: 	  %% Not with local functions either
 3275: 	  {clash20,
 3276:            <<"-export([binary_port/3]).
 3277:               -import(x,[binary_part/3]).
 3278:               binary_port(A,B,C) ->
 3279:                  binary_part(A,B,C).
 3280:              ">>,
 3281: 	   [warn_unused_import],
 3282: 	   {warnings,[{{2,16},erl_lint,{redefine_bif_import,{binary_part,3}}}]}},
 3283: 	  %% Don't accept call to a guard BIF if there is a local definition
 3284: 	  %% or an import with the same name. Note: is_record/2 is an
 3285: 	  %% exception, since it is more of syntatic sugar than a real BIF.
 3286: 	  {clash21,
 3287:            <<"-export([is_list/1]).
 3288:               -import(x, [is_tuple/1]).
 3289:               -record(r, {a,b}).
 3290:               x(T) when is_tuple(T) -> ok;
 3291:               x(T) when is_list(T) -> ok.
 3292:               y(T) when is_tuple(T) =:= true -> ok;
 3293:               y(T) when is_list(T) =:= true -> ok;
 3294:               y(T) when is_record(T, r, 3) -> ok;
 3295:               y(T) when is_record(T, r, 3) =:= true -> ok;
 3296:               y(T) when is_record(T, r) =:= true -> ok.
 3297:               is_list(_) ->
 3298:                 ok.
 3299:               is_record(_, _) ->
 3300:                 ok.
 3301:               is_record(_, _, _) ->
 3302:                 ok.
 3303:              ">>,
 3304: 	   [{no_auto_import,[{is_tuple,1}]}],
 3305: 	   {errors,[{{4,25},erl_lint,{illegal_guard_local_call,{is_tuple,1}}},
 3306: 		    {{5,25},erl_lint,{illegal_guard_local_call,{is_list,1}}},
 3307: 		    {{6,25},erl_lint,{illegal_guard_local_call,{is_tuple,1}}},
 3308: 		    {{7,25},erl_lint,{illegal_guard_local_call,{is_list,1}}},
 3309: 		    {{8,25},erl_lint,{illegal_guard_local_call,{is_record,3}}},
 3310: 		    {{9,25},erl_lint,{illegal_guard_local_call,{is_record,3}}}],[]}},
 3311: 	  %% We can also suppress all auto imports at once
 3312: 	  {clash22,
 3313:           <<"-export([size/1, binary_part/2]).
 3314:              -compile(no_auto_import).
 3315:              size([]) ->
 3316:                0;
 3317:              size({N,_}) ->
 3318:                N;
 3319:              size([_|T]) ->
 3320:                1+size(T).
 3321:              binary_part({B,_},{X,Y}) ->
 3322:                binary_part(B,{X,Y});
 3323:              binary_part(B,{X,Y}) ->
 3324:                binary:part(B,X,Y).
 3325:             ">>,
 3326: 	   [],
 3327: 	   []}
 3328: 	 ],
 3329: 
 3330:     [] = run(Config, Ts),
 3331:     ok.
 3332:

 3465: %% OTP-11861. behaviour_info() and -callback.
 3466: otp_11861(Conf) when is_list(Conf) ->
 3467:     CallbackFiles = [callback1, callback2, callback3,
 3468:                      bad_behaviour1, bad_behaviour2],
 3469:     lists:foreach(fun(M) ->
 3470:                           F = filename:join(?datadir, M),
 3471:                           Opts = [{outdir,?privdir}, return],
 3472:                           {ok, M, []} = compile:file(F, Opts)
 3473:                   end, CallbackFiles),
 3474:     CodePath = code:get_path(),
 3475:     true = code:add_path(?privdir),
 3476:     Ts = [{otp_11861_1,
 3477:            <<"
 3478:               -export([b1/1]).
 3479:               -behaviour(callback1).
 3480:               -behaviour(callback2).
 3481: 
 3482:               -spec b1(atom()) -> integer().
 3483:               b1(A) when is_atom(A)->
 3484:                   3.
 3485:              ">>,
 3486:            [],
 3487:            %% b2/1 is optional in both modules
 3488:            {warnings,[{{4,16},erl_lint,
 3489:                        {conflicting_behaviours,{b1,1},callback2,{3,16},callback1}}]}},
 3490:           {otp_11861_2,
 3491:            <<"
 3492:               -export([b2/1]).
 3493:               -behaviour(callback1).
 3494:               -behaviour(callback2).
 3495: 
 3496:               -spec b2(integer()) -> atom().
 3497:               b2(I) when is_integer(I)->
 3498:                   a.
 3499:              ">>,
 3500:            [],
 3501:            %% b2/1 is optional in callback2, but not in callback1
 3502:            {warnings,[{{3,16},erl_lint,{undefined_behaviour_func,{b1,1},callback1}},
 3503:                       {{4,16},erl_lint,
 3504:                        {conflicting_behaviours,{b2,1},callback2,{3,16},callback1}}]}},
 3505:           {otp_11861_3,
 3506:            <<"
 3507:               -callback b(_) -> atom().
 3508:               -optional_callbacks({b1,1}). % non-existing and ignored
 3509:              ">>,
 3510:            [],
 3511:            []},
 3512:           {otp_11861_4,
 3513:            <<"
 3514:               -callback b(_) -> atom().
 3515:               -optional_callbacks([{b1,1}]). % non-existing
 3516:              ">>,
 3517:            [],
 3518:            %% No behaviour-info(), but callback.
 3519:            {errors,[{{3,16},erl_lint,{undefined_callback,{lint_test,b1,1}}}],[]}},
 3520:           {otp_11861_5,
 3521:            <<"
 3522:               -optional_callbacks([{b1,1}]). % non-existing
 3523:              ">>,
 3524:            [],
 3525:            %% No behaviour-info() and no callback: warning anyway
 3526:            {errors,[{{2,16},erl_lint,{undefined_callback,{lint_test,b1,1}}}],[]}},
 3527:           {otp_11861_6,
 3528:            <<"
 3529:               -optional_callbacks([b1/1]). % non-existing
 3530:               behaviour_info(callbacks) -> [{b1,1}].
 3531:              ">>,
 3532:            [],
 3533:            %% behaviour-info() and no callback: warning anyway
 3534:            {errors,[{{2,16},erl_lint,{undefined_callback,{lint_test,b1,1}}}],[]}},
 3535:           {otp_11861_7,
 3536:            <<"
 3537:               -optional_callbacks([b1/1]). % non-existing
 3538:               -callback b(_) -> atom().
 3539:               behaviour_info(callbacks) -> [{b1,1}].
 3540:              ">>,
 3541:            [],
 3542:            %% behaviour-info() callback: warning
 3543:            {errors,[{{2,16},erl_lint,{undefined_callback,{lint_test,b1,1}}},
 3544:                     {{3,16},erl_lint,{behaviour_info,{lint_test,b,1}}}],
 3545:             []}},
 3546:           {otp_11861_8,
 3547:            <<"
 3548:               -callback b(_) -> atom().
 3549:               -optional_callbacks([b/1, {b, 1}]).
 3550:              ">>,
 3551:            [],
 3552:            {errors,[{{3,16},erl_lint,{redefine_optional_callback,{b,1}}}],[]}},
 3553:           {otp_11861_9,
 3554:            <<"
 3555:               -behaviour(gen_server).
 3556:               -export([handle_call/3,handle_cast/2,handle_info/2,
 3557:                        code_change/3, init/1, terminate/2]).
 3558:               handle_call(_, _, _) -> ok.
 3559:               handle_cast(_, _) -> ok.
 3560:               handle_info(_, _) -> ok.
 3561:               code_change(_, _, _) -> ok.
 3562:               init(_) -> ok.
 3563:               terminate(_, _) -> ok.
 3564:              ">>,
 3565:            [],
 3566:            []},

 3575:               code_change(_, _, _) -> ok.

 3650: %% Test that the new utf8/utf16/utf32 types do not allow size or
 3651: %% unit specifiers.
 3652: otp_7550(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3653:     Ts = [{otp_7550,
 3654:            <<"f8(A) ->
 3655:                   <<A:8/utf8>>.
 3656:               g8(A) ->
 3657:                   <<A:8/utf8-unit:1>>.
 3658:               h8(A) ->
 3659:                   <<A/utf8-unit:1>>.
 3660: 
 3661:               f16(A) ->
 3662:                   <<A:8/utf16>>.
 3663:               g16(A) ->
 3664:                   <<A:8/utf16-unit:1>>.
 3665:               h16(A) ->
 3666:                   <<A/utf16-unit:1>>.
 3667: 
 3668:               f32(A) ->
 3669:                   <<A:8/utf32>>.
 3670:               g32(A) ->
 3671:                   <<A:8/utf32-unit:1>>.
 3672:               h32(A) ->
 3673:                   <<A/utf32-unit:1>>.
 3674:              ">>,
 3675:            [],
 3676:            {errors,[{{2,21},erl_lint,utf_bittype_size_or_unit},
 3677: 		    {{4,21},erl_lint,utf_bittype_size_or_unit},
 3678: 		    {{6,21},erl_lint,utf_bittype_size_or_unit},
 3679: 		    {{9,21},erl_lint,utf_bittype_size_or_unit},
 3680: 		    {{11,21},erl_lint,utf_bittype_size_or_unit},
 3681: 		    {{13,21},erl_lint,utf_bittype_size_or_unit},
 3682: 		    {{16,21},erl_lint,utf_bittype_size_or_unit},
 3683: 		    {{18,21},erl_lint,utf_bittype_size_or_unit},
 3684: 		    {{20,21},erl_lint,utf_bittype_size_or_unit}
 3685: 		   ],
 3686:             []}}],
 3687:     [] = run(Config, Ts),
 3688:     ok.

 3691: %% Bugfix: -opaque with invalid type.
 3692: otp_8051(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3693:     Ts = [{otp_8051,
 3694:            <<"-opaque foo() :: bar().
 3695:               -export_type([foo/0]).
 3696:              ">>,

 3701: 
 3702: %% Check that format warnings are generated.
 3703: format_warn(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3704:     L1 = 16,
 3705:     L2 = 5,
 3706:     format_level(1, L1, Config),
 3707:     format_level(2, L1+L2, Config),
 3708:     format_level(3, L1+L2, Config),             %there is no level 3
 3709:     ok.
 3710: 
 3711: format_level(Level, Count, Config) ->
 3712:     W = get_compilation_result(Config, "format",
 3713:                                      [{warn_format, Level}]),
 3714:     %% Pick out the 'format' warnings.
 3715:     FW = lists:filter(fun({_Line, erl_lint, {format_error, _}}) -> true;
 3716:                                (_) -> false
 3717:                             end,
 3718:                             W),
 3719:     case length(FW) of
 3720:               Count ->
 3721:                   ok;
 3722:               Other ->
 3723:                   io:format("Expected ~w warning(s); got ~w", [Count,Other]),
 3724:                   fail()
 3725:           end,
 3726:     ok.
 3727:

 3729:

 3731: on_load_successful(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3732:     Ts = [{on_load_1,
 3733: 	   %% Exported on_load function.

 3735:              -on_load(do_on_load/0).
 3736:              do_on_load() -> ok.
 3737:              ">>,
 3738: 	   {[]},				%Tuple indicates no 'export_all'.

 3742: 	   %% Local on_load function.

 3745:              ">>,
 3746: 	   {[]},				%Tuple indicates no 'export_all'.
 3747: 	   []},

 3750: 	   %% Local on_load function, calling other local functions.
 3751: 	   <<"-on_load(do_on_load/0).

 3754:              bar(N) -> 2*N.
 3755:              ">>,
 3756: 	   {[]},				%Tuple indicates no 'export_all'.
 3757: 	   []}

 4218: %% OTP-11879: The -spec f/a :: (As) -> B; syntax removed,
 4219: %% and is_subtype/2 deprecated.
 4220: otp_11879(_Config) ->
 4221:     Fs = [{attribute,0,file,{"file.erl",0}},
 4222:           {attribute,0,module,m},
 4223:           {attribute,1,spec,
 4224:            {{f,1},
 4225:             [{type,2,'fun',[{type,3,product,[{var,4,'V1'},
 4226:                                              {var,5,'V1'}]},
 4227:                             {type,6,integer,[]}]}]}},
 4228:           {attribute,20,callback,
 4229:            {{cb,21},
 4230:             [{type,22,'fun',[{type,23,product,[{var,24,'V1'},
 4231:                                                {var,25,'V1'}]},
 4232:                              {type,6,integer,[]}]}]}}],
 4233:     {error,[{"file.erl",
 4234:              [{1,erl_lint,{spec_fun_undefined,{f,1}}},
 4235:               {2,erl_lint,spec_wrong_arity},
 4236:               {22,erl_lint,callback_wrong_arity}]}],
 4237:      []} = compile_forms(Fs, [return,report]),
 4238:     ok.
 4239: 
 4240: compile_forms(Terms, Opts) ->
 4241:     Forms = [erl_parse:anno_from_term(Term) || Term <- Terms],
 4242:     compile:forms(Forms, Opts).
 4243: 
 4244: %% OTP-13230: -deprecated without -module.
 4245: otp_13230(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 4246:     Abstr = <<"-deprecated([{frutt,0,next_version}]).">>,
 4247:     {errors,[{{1,2},erl_lint,undefined_module},
 4248:              {{1,2},erl_lint,{bad_deprecated,{frutt,0}}}],
 4249:      []} = run_test2(Config, Abstr, []),
 4250:     ok.

 4252: record_errors(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 4253:     Ts = [{rec1,
 4254:            <<"-record(r, {a,b}).
 4255:               b() -> #r{a=foo,b=42,a=bar}.
 4256:               u(R) -> R#r{a=1,b=2,a=2}.
 4257:              ">>,
 4258:            [],
 4259:            {errors,[{{2,36},erl_lint,{redefine_field,r,a}},
 4260: 		    {{3,35},erl_lint,{redefine_field,r,a}}],[]}}],
 4261:     run(Config, Ts).
 4262: 
 4263: otp_11879_cont(Config) ->
 4264:     Ts = [{constraint1,
 4265:            <<"-export([t/1]).
 4266:               -spec t(X) -> X when is_subtype(integer()).
 4267:               t(a) -> foo:bar().
 4268:              ">>,
 4269:            [],
 4270:            {errors,
 4271:             [{{2,36},erl_parse,"unsupported constraint " ++ ["is_subtype"]}],
 4272:             []}},
 4273:           {constraint2,
 4274:            <<"-export([t/1]).
 4275:               -spec t(X) -> X when bad_atom(X, integer()).
 4276:               t(a) -> foo:bar().
 4277:              ">>,
 4278:            [],
 4279:            {errors,
 4280:             [{{2,36},erl_parse,"unsupported constraint " ++ ["bad_atom"]}],
 4281:             []}},
 4282:           {constraint3,
 4283:            <<"-export([t/1]).
 4284:               -spec t(X) -> X when is_subtype(bad_variable, integer()).
 4285:               t(a) -> foo:bar().
 4286:              ">>,
 4287:            [],
 4288:            {errors,[{{2,47},erl_parse,"bad type variable"}],[]}},
 4289:           {constraint4,
 4290:            <<"-export([t/1]).
 4291:               -spec t(X) -> X when is_subtype(atom(), integer()).
 4292:               t(a) -> foo:bar().
 4293:              ">>,
 4294:            [],
 4295:            {errors,[{{2,47},erl_parse,"bad type variable"}],[]}},
 4296:           {constraint5,
 4297:            <<"-export([t/1]).
 4298:               -spec t(X) -> X when is_subtype(X, integer()).
 4299:               t(a) -> foo:bar().
 4300:              ">>,
 4301:            [],
 4302:            []},
 4303:           {constraint6,
 4304:            <<"-export([t/1]).
 4305:               -spec t(X) -> X when X :: integer().
 4306:               t(a) -> foo:bar().
 4307:              ">>,
 4308:            [],
 4309:            []}],
 4310:     run(Config, Ts).
 4311: 
 4312: %% OTP-14285: We currently don't support non-latin1 module names.
 4313: 
 4314: non_latin1_module(Config) ->
 4315:     Expected = [non_latin1_module_unsupported],
 4316:     Expected = check_module_name(''),
 4317:     Expected = check_module_name(list_to_atom([256,$a,$b,$c])),
 4318:     Expected = check_module_name(list_to_atom([$a,$b,256,$c])),
 4319: 
 4320:     "module names with non-latin1 characters are not supported" =
 4321:         format_error(non_latin1_module_unsupported),
 4322:     BadCallback =
 4323:         {bad_callback,{' ',' ',0}},
 4324:     BadModule =
 4325:         {bad_module,{' ',' ',0}},
 4326:     "explicit module not allowed for callback "
 4327:     "' ':' '/0" =
 4328:         format_error(BadCallback),
 4329:     UndefBehav = {undefined_behaviour,' '},
 4330:     "behaviour ' ' undefined" =
 4331:         format_error(UndefBehav),
 4332:     Ts = [{non_latin1_module,
 4333:            <<"
 4334:             %% Report uses of module names with non-Latin-1 characters.
 4335: 
 4336:             -import(' ', []).
 4337:             -behaviour(' ').
 4338:             -behavior(' ').
 4339: 
 4340:             -callback ' ':' '() -> a.
 4341: 
 4342:             %% erl_lint:gexpr/3 is not extended to check module name here:
 4343:             t1() when ' ':' '(1) ->
 4344:                 b.
 4345: 
 4346:             t2() ->
 4347:                 ' ':' '().
 4348: 
 4349:             -spec ' ':' '() -> atom().
 4350: 
 4351:             -spec ' '(integer()) ->
 4352:               ' ':' '().
 4353: 
 4354:             ' '(1) ->
 4355:                 ' ':f(),
 4356:                 F = f,
 4357:                 ' ':F()."/utf8>>,
 4358:            [],
 4359:            {error,
 4360:             [{{4,14},erl_lint,non_latin1_module_unsupported},
 4361:              {{5,14},erl_lint,non_latin1_module_unsupported},
 4362:              {{6,14},erl_lint,non_latin1_module_unsupported},
 4363:              {{8,14},erl_lint,non_latin1_module_unsupported},
 4364:              {{8,14},erl_lint,BadCallback},
 4365:              {{11,23},erl_lint,illegal_guard_expr},
 4366:              {{15,17},erl_lint,non_latin1_module_unsupported},
 4367:              {{17,14},erl_lint,non_latin1_module_unsupported},
 4368:              {{17,14},erl_lint,BadModule},
 4369:              {{20,15},erl_lint,non_latin1_module_unsupported},
 4370:              {{23,17},erl_lint,non_latin1_module_unsupported},
 4371:              {{25,17},erl_lint,non_latin1_module_unsupported}],
 4372:             [{{5,14},erl_lint,UndefBehav},
 4373:              {{6,14},erl_lint,UndefBehav}]}}],
 4374:     run(Config, Ts),
 4375:     ok.
 4376: 
 4377: illegal_module_name(_Config) ->
 4378:     [empty_module_name] = check_module_name(''),
 4379: 
 4380:     [ctrl_chars_in_module_name] = check_module_name('\x00'),
 4381:     [ctrl_chars_in_module_name] = check_module_name('abc\x1F'),
 4382:     [ctrl_chars_in_module_name] = check_module_name('\x7F'),
 4383:     [ctrl_chars_in_module_name] = check_module_name('abc\x80'),
 4384:     [ctrl_chars_in_module_name] = check_module_name('abc\x80xyz'),
 4385:     [ctrl_chars_in_module_name] = check_module_name('\x9Fxyz'),
 4386: 
 4387:     [ctrl_chars_in_module_name,
 4388:      non_latin1_module_unsupported] = check_module_name('\x00'),
 4389: 
 4390:     [blank_module_name] = check_module_name(' '),
 4391:     [blank_module_name] = check_module_name('\xA0'),
 4392:     [blank_module_name] = check_module_name('\xAD'),
 4393:     [blank_module_name] = check_module_name('  \xA0\xAD '),
 4394: 
 4395:     %% White space and soft hyphens are OK if there are visible
 4396:     %% characters in the name.
 4397:     ok = check_module_name(' abc '),
 4398:     ok = check_module_name('abc '),
 4399:     ok = check_module_name(' abc '),
 4400:     ok = check_module_name(' abc xyz '),
 4401:     ok = check_module_name(' abc\xADxyz '),
 4402: 
 4403:     ok.
 4404: 
 4405: check_module_name(Mod) ->
 4406:     File = atom_to_list(Mod) ++ ".erl",
 4407:     L1 = erl_anno:new(1),
 4408:     Forms = [{attribute,L1,file,{File,1}},
 4409:              {attribute,L1,module,Mod},
 4410:              {eof,2}],
 4411:     _ = compile:forms(Forms),
 4412:     case compile:forms(Forms, [return]) of
 4413:         {error,Errors,[]} ->
 4414:             [{_ModName,L}] = Errors,
 4415:             lists:sort([Reason || {1,erl_lint,Reason} <- L]);
 4416:         {ok,Mod,Code,Ws} when is_binary(Code), is_list(Ws)  ->
 4417:             ok
 4418:     end.
 4419: 
 4420: otp_14378(Config) ->
 4421:     Ts = [
 4422:           {otp_14378_1,
 4423:            <<"-export([t/0]).
 4424:               -compile({nowarn_deprecated_function,{erlang,now,1}}).
 4425:               t() ->
 4426:                  erlang:now().">>,
 4427:            [],
 4428:            {warnings,[{{4,18},erl_lint,
 4429:                        {deprecated,{erlang,now,0},
 4430:                         "see the \"Time and Time Correction in Erlang\" "
 4431:                         "chapter of the ERTS User's Guide for more "
 4432:                         "information"}}]}}],
 4433:     [] = run(Config, Ts),
 4434:     ok.

 4484: stacktrace_syntax(Config) ->
 4485:     Ts = [{guard,

 4487:                   try error(foo)
 4488:                   catch _:_:Stk when is_number(Stk) -> ok
 4489:                   end.
 4490:            ">>,
 4491:            [],
 4492:            {errors,[{{3,48},erl_lint,{stacktrace_guard,'Stk'}}],[]}},
 4493:           {bound,
 4494:            <<"t1() ->
 4495:                   Stk = [],
 4496:                   try error(foo)
 4497:                   catch _:_:Stk -> ok
 4498:                   end.
 4499:            ">>,
 4500:            [],
 4501:            {errors,[{{4,29},erl_lint,{stacktrace_bound,'Stk'}}],[]}},
 4502:           {bound_in_pattern,
 4503:            <<"t1() ->
 4504:                   try error(foo)
 4505:                   catch _:{x,T}:T -> ok
 4506:                   end.
 4507:            ">>,
 4508:            [],
 4509:            {errors,[{{3,33},erl_lint,{stacktrace_bound,'T'}}],[]}},
 4510:           {guard_and_bound,

 4512:                   Stk = [],
 4513:                   try error(foo)
 4514:                   catch _:_:Stk when is_integer(Stk) -> ok
 4515:                   end.
 4516:            ">>,
 4517:            [],

 4519:                     {{4,49},erl_lint,{stacktrace_guard,'Stk'}}],[]}}
 4520:          ],
 4521: 
 4522:     run(Config, Ts),
 4523:     ok.

 4601: removed(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 4602:     Ts = [{removed,
 4603:           <<"-removed([{nonexistent,1,\"hi\"}]). %% okay since it doesn't exist
 4604:              -removed([frutt/0]).   %% okay since frutt/0 is not exported
 4605:              -removed([t/0]).       %% not okay since t/0 is exported
 4606:              -removed([{t,'_'}]).   %% not okay since t/0 is exported
 4607:              -removed([{'_','_'}]). %% not okay since t/0 is exported
 4608:              -removed([{{badly,formed},1}]).
 4609:              -removed('badly formed').
 4610:              -export([t/0]).
 4611:              frutt() -> ok.
 4612:              t() -> ok.
 4613:             ">>,
 4614:            {[]},
 4615:            {error,[{{3,15},erl_lint,{bad_removed,{t,0}}},
 4616:                    {{4,15},erl_lint,{bad_removed,{t,'_'}}},
 4617:                    {{5,15},erl_lint,{bad_removed,{'_','_'}}},
 4618:                    {{6,15},erl_lint,{invalid_removed,{{badly,formed},1}}},

 4625: otp_16516(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 4626:     one_multi_init(Config),
 4627:     several_multi_inits(Config).
 4628: 
 4629: one_multi_init(Config) ->
 4630:     "'_' initializes no omitted fields" =
 4631:         format_error(bad_multi_field_init),
 4632:     Ts = [{otp_16516_1,
 4633:            <<"-record(r, {f}).
 4634:               t(#r{f = 17, _ = V}) ->
 4635:                   V.
 4636:               u(#r{_ = V, f = 17}) ->
 4637:                   V.
 4638:               -record(r1, {f, g = 17}).
 4639:               g(#r1{f = 3, _ = 42}) ->
 4640:                 g.
 4641:              ">>,
 4642:            [],
 4643:            {errors,[{{2,28},erl_lint,bad_multi_field_init},
 4644:                     {{4,20},erl_lint,bad_multi_field_init}],[]}},
 4645:           {otp_16516_2,
 4646:            %% No error since "_ = '_'" is actually used as a catch-all
 4647:            %% initialization. V is unused (as compilation with the 'E'
 4648:            %% option shows), but no warning about V being unused is
 4649:            %% output.
 4650:            <<"-record(r, {f}).
 4651:               t(V) ->
 4652:                   #r{f = 3, _ = V}.
 4653:               u(V) ->
 4654:                   #r{_ = V, f = 3}.
 4655:              ">>,
 4656:            [],
 4657:            []},
 4658:           {otp_16516_3,
 4659:            %% No error in this case either. And no unused variable warning.
 4660:            <<"-record(r, {f}).
 4661:               t(V) when #r{f = 3, _ = V} =:= #r{f = 3} ->
 4662:                   a.
 4663:               u(V) when #r{_ = V, f = 3} =:= #r{f = 3} ->
 4664:                   a.
 4665:              ">>,
 4666:            [],
 4667:            []}],
 4668:     [] = run(Config, Ts).
 4669: 
 4670: several_multi_inits(Config) ->
 4671:     Ts = [{otp_16516_4,
 4672:            <<"-record(r, {f, g}).
 4673:               t(#r{f = 17, _ = V1,
 4674:                            _ = V2}) ->
 4675:                   {V1, V2}.
 4676:               u(#r{_ = V1, f = 17,
 4677:                    _ = V2}) ->
 4678:                   {V1, V2}.
 4679:               v(#r{_ = V1, f = 17}) ->
 4680:                   V1.
 4681:              ">>,
 4682:            [],
 4683:            {errors,[{{3,28},erl_lint,bad_multi_field_init},
 4684:                     {{4,20},erl_lint,{unbound_var,'V1'}},
 4685:                     {{4,24},erl_lint,{unbound_var,'V2'}},
 4686:                     {{6,20},erl_lint,bad_multi_field_init},
 4687:                     {{7,20},erl_lint,{unbound_var,'V1'}},
 4688:                     {{7,24},erl_lint,{unbound_var,'V2'}}],[]}},
 4689:           {otp_16516_5,
 4690:            <<"-record(r, {f, g}).
 4691:               t(V1, V2) ->
 4692:                   #r{_ = V1, f = 3,
 4693:                      _ = V2}.

 4695:                   #r{_ = V1,
 4696:                      _ = V2, f = 3}.
 4697:              ">>,
 4698:            [],

 4704:            <<"-record(r, {f, g}).

 4707:                   a.

 4709:                                 _ = V2} =:= #r{} ->
 4710:                   a.
 4711:              ">>,
 4712:            [],

 4714:                    {{6,33},erl_lint,bad_multi_field_init}],

 4764: warn_missing_spec(Config) ->
 4765:     Test = <<"-export([external_with_spec/0, external_no_spec/0]).
 4766: 
 4767:               -spec external_with_spec() -> ok.
 4768:               external_with_spec() -> ok.
 4769: 
 4770:               external_no_spec() -> ok.
 4771: 
 4772:               -spec internal_with_spec() -> ok.
 4773:               internal_with_spec() -> ok.
 4774: 
 4775:               internal_no_spec() -> ok.">>,
 4776: 
 4777:     %% Be sure to avoid adding export_all using the option-list-in-a-tuple trick.
 4778:     {warnings, [{{6,15}, erl_lint, {missing_spec, {external_no_spec, 0}}}]} =
 4779:         run_test(Config, Test, {[warn_missing_spec, nowarn_unused_function]}),
 4780: 
 4781:     Ts = [{warn_missing_spec_all, Test, [warn_missing_spec_all],
 4782:            {warnings, [{{6,15}, erl_lint, {missing_spec, {external_no_spec, 0}}},
 4783:                        {{11,15}, erl_lint, {missing_spec, {internal_no_spec, 0}}}]}},
 4784:           {warn_missing_spec_export_all,
 4785:            <<"-compile([export_all, nowarn_export_all]).
 4786:               -compile([warn_missing_spec]).
 4787:               main(_) -> ok.
 4788:              ">>,
 4789:            [],
 4790:            {warnings,[{{3,15},erl_lint,{missing_spec,{main,1}}}]}}],
 4791:     run(Config, Ts).
 4792:

 4828: underscore_match(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 4829:     Test = <<"
 4830:                 match_underscore() ->
 4831:                     _Test = id(13),
 4832:                     case id(_Test) of               %% Usage: no warning.
 4833:                         _Test -> handle:msg(_Test)  %% Match: warning.
 4834:                     end.
 4835: 
 4836:                 f(_A, _A, _A) ->                    %% Match: warning.
 4837:                     _A.                             %% Usage: no warning.
 4838: 
 4839:                 t(_T, _T) ->                            %% Match: warning.
 4840:                     case _T of                          %% Usage: no warning.
 4841:                         {_T,_T} ->                      %% Match: warning.
 4842:                             {_T,_T} =                   %% Match: warning.
 4843:                                 fun(_T1, _T1) ->        %% Match: warning.
 4844:                                         {_T,_T} = _T1   %% Match: warning.
 4845:                                 end,
 4846:                         [_T = T2 || T2 <- _T],          %% Match: warning.
 4847:                         [{_T,_T} || _ <- _T]            %% Usage: no warning.
 4848:                     end.
 4849: 
 4850:                 id(I) -> I.
 4851:            ">>,

 5206:              "t(A) when A =:= {0.0} -> ok.\n" %% Should warn.
 5207:              "k(A) -> A =:= 0.0.\n" %% Should warn.
 5208:              "q(A) -> A =:= {0.0}.\n" %% Should warn.
 5209:              "z(A) when A =:= +0.0 -> ok;\n" %% Should not warn.
 5210:              "z(A) when A =:= {+0.0} -> ok.\n">>, %% Should not warn.
 5211:            [],

 5267: 
 5268: %%%
 5269: %%% Common utilities.
 5270: %%%
 5271: 
 5272: format_error(E) ->
 5273:     lists:flatten(erl_lint:format_error(E)).
 5274: 
 5275: run(Config, Tests) ->
 5276:     F = fun({N,P,Ws,E}, BadL) ->
 5277:                 io:format("### ~s\n", [N]),
 5278:                 case catch run_test(Config, P, Ws) of
 5279:                     E -> 
 5280:                         BadL;
 5281:                     Bad -> 
 5282:                         io:format("~nTest ~p failed. Expected~n  ~p~n"
 5283:                                   "but got~n  ~p~n", [N, E, Bad]),
 5284: 			fail()
 5285:                 end
 5286:         end,
 5287:     lists:foldl(F, [], Tests).
 5288: 
 5289: %% Compiles a test file and returns the list of warnings/errors.
 5290: 
 5291: get_compilation_result(Conf, Filename, Warnings) ->
 5292:     DataDir = ?datadir,
 5293:     File = filename:join(DataDir, Filename),
 5294:     {ok,Bin} = file:read_file(File++".erl"),
 5295:     FileS = binary_to_list(Bin),
 5296:     {match,[{Start,Length}|_]} = re:run(FileS, "-module.*\\n"),
 5297:     Test = lists:nthtail(Start+Length, FileS),
 5298:     case run_test(Conf, Test, Warnings) of
 5299:         {warnings, Ws} -> Ws;
 5300:         {errors,Es,Ws} -> {Es,Ws};
 5301:         [] -> []
 5302:     end.
 5303: 
 5304: %% Compiles a test module and returns the list of errors and warnings.
 5305: 
 5306: run_test(Conf, Test0, Warnings0) ->
 5307:     Test = list_to_binary(["-module(lint_test). ", Test0]),
 5308:     run_test2(Conf, Test, Warnings0).
 5309: 
 5310: run_test2(Conf, Test, Warnings0) ->
 5311:     Filename = "lint_test.erl",
 5312:     DataDir = ?privdir,
 5313:     File = filename:join(DataDir, Filename),
 5314:     Opts = case Warnings0 of
 5315:                {Warnings} ->		%Hairy trick to not add export_all.
 5316:                    [return|Warnings];
 5317:                Warnings ->
 5318:                    [export_all,return|Warnings]
 5319:            end,
 5320:     ok = file:write_file(File, Test),
 5321: 
 5322:     %% We will use the 'binary' option so that the compiler will not
 5323:     %% compare the module name to the output file name. Also, there
 5324:     %% is no reason to produce an output file since we are only
 5325:     %% interested in the errors and warnings.
 5326: 
 5327:     %% Print warnings, call erl_lint:format_error/1. (But note that
 5328:     %% the compiler will ignore failing calls to erl_lint:format_error/1.)
 5329:     compile:file(File, [binary,report|Opts]),
 5330: 
 5331:     case compile:file(File, [binary|Opts]) of
 5332:         {ok, _M, Code, Ws} when is_binary(Code) ->
 5333:             warnings(File, Ws, Test);
 5334:         {error, [{File,Es}], []} ->
 5335:             print_diagnostics(Es, Test),
 5336: 	    {errors, call_format_error(Es), []};
 5337:         {error, [{File,Es}], [{File,Ws}]} ->
 5338:             print_diagnostics(Es, Test),
 5339:             print_diagnostics(Ws, Test),
 5340: 	    {error, call_format_error(Es), call_format_error(Ws)};
 5341:         {error, [{File,Es1},{File,Es2}], []} ->
 5342:             print_diagnostics(Es1, Test),
 5343:             print_diagnostics(Es2, Test),
 5344: 	    {errors2, Es1, Es2}
 5345:     end.
 5346: 
 5347: warnings(File, Ws, Source) ->
 5348:     case lists:append([W || {F, W} <- Ws, F =:= File]) of
 5349:         [] ->
 5350: 	    [];
 5351:         L ->
 5352:             print_diagnostics(L, Source),
 5353: 	    {warnings, call_format_error(L)}
 5354:     end.
 5355: 
 5356: call_format_error(L) ->
 5357:     %% Smoke test of format_error/1 to make sure that no crashes
 5358:     %% slip through.
 5359:     _ = [Mod:format_error(Term) || {_,Mod,Term} <- L],
 5360:     L.
 5361: 
 5362: print_diagnostics(Warnings, Source) ->
 5363:     case binary:match(Source, <<"-file(">>) of
 5364:         nomatch ->
 5365:             Lines = binary:split(Source, <<"\n">>, [global]),
 5366:             Cs = [print_diagnostic(W, Lines) || W <- Warnings],
 5367:             io:put_chars(Cs);
 5368:         _ ->
 5369:             %% There are probably fake line numbers greater than
 5370:             %% the number of actual lines.
 5371:             ok
 5372:     end.
 5373: 
 5374: print_diagnostic({{LineNum,Column},Mod,Data}, Lines) ->
 5375:     Line0 = lists:nth(LineNum, Lines),
 5376:     <<Line1:(Column-1)/binary,_/binary>> = Line0,
 5377:     Spaces = re:replace(Line1, <<"[^\t]">>, <<" ">>, [global]),
 5378:     CaretLine = [Spaces,"^"],
 5379:     [io_lib:format("~p:~p: ~ts\n", [LineNum,Column,Mod:format_error(Data)]),
 5380:      Line0, "\n",
 5381:      CaretLine, "\n\n"];
 5382: print_diagnostic(_, _) ->
 5383:     [].
 5384: 
 5385: fail() ->
 5386:     ct:fail(failed).
